ltl2rabin

Class GDRAFactory

  • Object
    • ltl2rabin.AutomatonFactory<LTLFactory.Result,Pair<PropEquivalenceClass,List<SubAutomaton.State>>,Set<String>>
      • ltl2rabin.GDRAFactory

  • public class GDRAFactory
extends AutomatonFactory<LTLFactory.Result,Pair<PropEquivalenceClass,List<SubAutomaton.State>>,Set<String>>
    A GDRAFactory can create a GDRA out of the LTLFactory.Result of an LTLFactory. A GDRA represents a Generalized Deterministic Rabin Automaton. The construction used by the createFrom(LTLFactory.Result) method was introduced in the paper "From LTL to Deterministic Automata -- A Safraless Compositional Approach" by Javier Esparza et al. This implementation of this algorithm is explained in the Bachelor's Thesis "Deterministic ω-Automata for LTL: An efficient and scalable implementation" by Hannes Bibel.

    The creation of a GDRA can take minutes, hours, or even days, so be patient. If the computation takes long, it might not be an error, but the result might simply be huge.

    This class is a subclass of the AutomatonFactory class. It doesn't inherit any actual functionality though.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GDRAFactory(ImmutableSet<Set<String>> alphabet)
      Creates a new GDRAFactory while ignoring the alphabet parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GDRAFactory

        public GDRAFactory(ImmutableSet<Set<String>> alphabet)
        Creates a new GDRAFactory while ignoring the alphabet parameter. The best way to create a GDRAFactory is with new GDRAFactory(ImmutableSet.of()). The parameter only exists because this method is inherited by the abstract AutomatonFactory class.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - This parameter only exists for reasons of conformity with the base class AutomatonFactory. It is ignored and never used.

    • Method Detail

      • createFrom

        public GDRA createFrom(LTLFactory.Result parserResult)
        This method returns a GDRA (Generalized Deterministic Rabin Automaton). It computes the set of states, the transitions and the acceptance sets.
        Specified by:
        createFrom in class AutomatonFactory<LTLFactory.Result,Pair<PropEquivalenceClass,List<SubAutomaton.State>>,Set<String>>
        Parameters:
        parserResult - The formula (phi), alphabet (sigma) and the set of G-subformulas that the method needs to create a GDRA. An LTLFactory.Result is produced by any LTLFactory, for example an LTLFactoryFromString.
        Returns:
        A complete GDRA, generated from the Formula given in the input.
